oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pocket dictionary with journal entries of Sgt. Johnson Basham West, Co. B, 2nd Ky. Cav. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This pocket dictionary was used by Sgt. Johnson Basham West, Co. B, 2nd Ky Cav. Regt., CSA. West wrote the movements of his unit on the interior margins of the dictionary. Inscriptions include: Fayetteville (Tenn." Mudlraugh Hill (Ky. Cumberland River, Woodbury (Tenn." Corydon (Ind." Buffington Island, (Ohio). West was captured on the Ohio Raid and held at various prison camps. After the war he became a doctor and practiced in Nashville, Tenn.
